description: Sea Surface Temperatures (SSTs) are restored to model climatology plus positive AMV anomaly by Newtonian cooling over the tropical north Atlantic (10N-30N). The restoring timescale is 10 days for a 50m deep mixed layer (or equivalent). The restoring coefficient of 40 W/m2/K should decrease to zero over an 8 degree buffer zone bounding the restored region.  No restoring if sea ice is present. Idealised AMV anomalies of SST will be provided by DCPP.
name: Restore SST AMV pos Tropical N Atlantic
rationale: To investigate the climate impacts of positive Atlantic Multidecadal Variability (AMV) anomalies.
longName: Restore tropical north Atlantic sea surface temperature to positive AMV
keywords: DCPP, SST, restored, AMV+, positive AMV, Positive Atlantic Multidecadal Variability, tropical north Atlantic
